routing_way_description: Routing is a way to make your application publicly visible.
name: Name
unique_name_for_Proxy: A unique name for the HTTP Proxy within the project.
public_hostname_description: Public hostname for the Route. If not specified, a hostname is generated.
plugin_used_description: The goal of the HTTPProxy Custom Resource Definition (CRD) is to expand upon the functionality of the Ingress API to allow for a richer user experience as well addressing the limitations of the latterâ€™s use in multi tenant environments.
alternate_service_http: Alternate Service to http proxy to.
weight_service_route: A number between 0 and 100 that depicts relative weight compared with other targets.
path_service_route: Path that the router watches to HTTP Proxy traffic to the service.
route_tls_certificates: Routes can be secured using several TLS termination types for serving certificates.
advance_description: HTTPProxies allows for the use of advanced configuration options in the YAML tab, offering greater flexibility and control over routing and load balancing behaviors.
label: Label
secret_info: Only TLS-type secrets are allowed for selection.
annotations_help_text: Annotations is an unstructured key value map stored with a resource that may be set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata. They are not queryable and should be preserved when modifying objects.
labels_help_text: Labels help you organize and select resources. Adding labels below will let you query for objects that have similar, overlapping or dissimilar labels.
confirm_delete_route: Are you sure you want to delete {{name}} in namespace {{namespace}}
error_route_required: At least one route is required
error_route_service_required: Route {{number}}: At least one service is required
error_route_service_name_required: Route {{number}}, Service {{serviceNumber}}: Service name is required
error_route_service_ca_secret: Route {{number}}, Service {{serviceNumber}}: CA Secret is required when validation is enabled
error_route_service_subject_name: Route {{number}}, Service {{serviceNumber}}: Subject Name is required when validation is enabled
error_secure_route_termination: TLS termination is required when secure route is enabled
error_secure_route_secret: Secret is required for Edge and Re-encrypt termination
validation_info: By default, the upstream TLS server certificate will not be validated, but validation can be requested by setting the spec.routes.services[].validation field. This field has mandatory caSecret and subjectName fields, which specify the trusted root certificates with which to validate the server certificate and the expected server name.
validation_info_note: Note: If spec.routes.services[].validation is present, spec.routes.services[].{name,port} must point to a Service with a matching projectcontour.io/upstream-protocol.tls Service annotation.
metrics_no_data_description: No data available for this query
